metadata.title: CVE-2014-1638 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
(1) debian/postrm and (2) debian/localepurge.config in localepurge before0.7.3.2 use tempfile to create a safe temporary file but appends a suffixto the original filename and writes to this new filename, which allowslocal users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the newfilename.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

localepurge - 0.7.3.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: localepurge package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.3.2').
